intro: Hypopeltis biserrata, commonly known as the serrated hypopeltis, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, compound leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This plant is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
